title: Golfers Navigate Tricky U.S. Open Course At Chambers Bay
teaser: For the first time, the U.S. Open golf championship will be played in the Pacific Northwest. The Chambers Bay course used to be a sand and gravel quarry next to Puget Sound. Players will have to use their imagination to conquer its quirks.
contentencoded: Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
